author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Gujarat High Court on Monday allowed the termination of a 24-week pregnancy of a teenage rape victim, who had swallowed acid after being raped. The court held that the victim-petitioner would suffer tremendous mental trauma if she continued with the pregnancy which was the result of the rape.

“The petitioner-victim has crumbled physically and mentally on account of rape … she has survived after consuming liquid in the form of acid and her condition is not sound that she may deliver the child inasmuch as her organs such as esophagus, liver, etc., are seriously damaged …”

‘Mental health affected’

“Since this continuance of pregnancy involves grave injury to her mental health as her pregnancy being the result of rape, the anguish caused is also to be constituted as a grave injury to the mental health of the victim, and therefore also, termination of pregnancy is permitted,” the court observed in its 15-page judgment.

Last week, the court directed the civil hospital in Sola to examine the mental and physical status of the victim to check if the pregnancy could be terminated.
title: Gujarat High Court allows rape victim to terminate 24-week pregnancy
